result.execSummary:
The defendant Raphaelle R Loving was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to City of Glendale in the amount of $408.00 by 11-27-2017 or civil judgment.

*Court ordered defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 11-27-2017.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*The Court ordered that restitution and all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), but not to exceed 60%.  Restitution to be paid first.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raphaelle R Loving

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raphaelle R Loving in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Raphaelle R Loving in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Victim Witness Impact Statement, filed.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction concurrent.  
Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to City of Glendale in the amount of $408.00 by 11-27-2017 or civil judgment.  
Court ordered defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 11-27-2017.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

The Court ordered that restitution and all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), but not to exceed 60%.  Restitution to be paid first.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Raphaelle R Loving not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant appearance waived. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM MSDF FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, Defendant Raphaelle R Loving not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from MSDF for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Raphaelle R Loving not in court, in custody.  Morgan Wilz, student intern, under the supervision of Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Hagner in court.  Morgan Willz supevised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Pretrial Confernece.  Defendant NOT in court, in custody at MSDF. Case is adjourend for Pretrial Conference to branch 23 on 8/27/2015 at 8:30 AM.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raphaelle R Loving in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Raphaelle R Loving in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.    All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Order to Produce for Initial Appearance on July 21, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed
